dataset.title: Public Facilities
dataset.description: Shows locations of public facilities including: fire stations, libraries, and police stations in St. Joseph County.

dataset.title: RSVP Properties
dataset.description:
This is a map of all properties that are scheduled for inspection or are registered under South Bend's Rental Safety Verification Program (RSVP) and their corresponding status beginning March 2019.

It includes the following data:
  • Property identification details (parcel IDs and addresses)
  • Property RSVP status (please see terminology definitions below)
  • Expiration date of RSVP certification or exemption
  • Name of property owner and owner's business name (if applicable)
  • Location (coordinates may be missing for parcels that have been consolidated)Terminology for property status:
    • Certified - property has met minimum standards
    • Condemned - property has extensive, major violations and the property is unsafe for occupancy
    • Conditional Certification - property requires non-critical repairs that can't be completed within 60 days (typically weather dependent, exterior repairs)
    • - property is owner-occupied and\/or non-residential
    • Exempt - property does not require an RSVP inspection (most often due to having received an inspection by another agency in the last 12 months)
    • Illegal for Non-owner Occupancy - inspections initiated or completed but property has not achieved certification
    • Inspection Process - property has an RSVP inspection scheduled
    • Under Review - we have initiated contact with the owner to schedule an inspection ~ or ~ someone has contacted Code Enforcement to schedule an inspection - but no inspection has been scheduled yet

dataset.title: Historic - Police Officer Commendations
dataset.description:
View commendations made by members of the community regarding behavior or service of South Bend Police Officers. The dataset starts on January 1, 2017 through 2021.

To view the current dataset, go to - Police Officer Commendations - Table

Have your own compliment about a South Bend Police Officer?
Submit a commendation HERE

To access various documents, dashboards and datasets on Police Transparency, click here.

dataset.title: Historic - Use of Force Incidents
dataset.description:
This dataset provides incident-level information on use of force incidents involving South Bend Police Officers. Incident-level data is released beginning in 2017 through 2021.

To see our newly updated map go to - Use of Force Incidents Map.


Note: The location of the incident is rounded to the 100-block in order to protect the privacy and anonymity of residents involved.

To access various documents, dashboards and datasets on Police Transparency, click here.

dataset.title: Police Officer Commendations - Table
dataset.description:
This is a downloadable dataset for commendations made about South Bend Police Officers beginning in 2021.

To view historic data (2017 - 2021), view at - Historic Police Officer Commendations

Have your own compliment about a South Bend Police Officer?
Submit a commendation HERE

To access various documents, dashboards and datasets on Police Transparency, click here.

dataset.title: SBPD Recruiting - Ethnicity
dataset.description:
This table is the demographic breakdown by Ethnicity for Police recruitment. This summary will be updated within a month after the completion of recruitment cycles.

For context and additional information about this dataset, you can visit our Police Recruitment Data Guide.

Reflects applications created on or after April 12, 2017 that have been part of completed recruitment cycles.

To access various documents, dashboards and datasets on Police Transparency, click here.

dataset.title: SBPD Recruitment Data
dataset.description:
Reflects applications created on or after April 12, 2017 that have been a part of completed recruitment cycles. Please note that each record/row is an application, not an applicant (i.e., an applicant may apply several times).

The "Last Hiring Stage" is reflective of the last stage that applicant completed in their application. For example, if the Last Hiring Stage completed is Passed Interview, they would count in every preceding stage. They would have received a "Background Fail" as their applicant status.

For context and additional information about this dataset, you can visit our Police Recruitment Data Guide.

This data will be updated within a month after the completion of recruitment cycles.

To access various documents, dashboards and datasets on Police Transparency, click here.

dataset.title: SBPD Recruiting - Gender
dataset.description:
This table is the demographic breakdown by Gender for Police recruitment. This summary will be updated within a month after the completion of recruitment cycles.

For context and additional information about this dataset, you can visit our Police Recruitment Data Guide.

Reflects applications created on or after April 12, 2017 that have been part of completed recruitment cycles.

To access various documents, dashboards and datasets on Police Transparency, click here.

dataset.title: Use of Force Incidents - Table
dataset.description:
This downloadable dataset provides incident-level information on use of force incidents involving South Bend Police Officers. Incident-level data is released beginning in 2021.

To see this data on a map, go to - Use of Force Incidents Map.

Note: The location of the incident is rounded to the 100-block in order to protect the privacy and anonymity of residents involved.

To access various documents, dashboards and datasets on Police Transparency, click here.

dataset.title: Use of Force - Annual Aggregates (Historic)
dataset.description:
This table shows historic aggregate use of force incidents and related complaints for the South Bend Police Department from 2014 through 2017. Beginning in 2017, use of force incidents and complaints were tracked at an incident level basis. You can go to the mapped use of force incident data here and the complaints data here.

To see incident level data visualized, please visit the SBPD Transparency Hub.

Calls for service, number of cases, and number of arrests are also provided for each year in order to provide context.

dataset.title: Animal Resource Center Monthly Statistics
dataset.description:
This data set is up-to-date as of January 2015, but is no longer actively maintained by the City of South Bend.

This data set includes statistics reported by South Bend Animal Resource Center including pet adoptions, pets returned home, rescue/rehab, and bite cases.

Updated statistics from South Bend's Animal Resource Center can be found on the following website: https://southbendin.gov/department/animal-resource-center/ordinances_reporting/.

dataset.title: Community Complaints - Table
dataset.description:
This dataset provides information about complaints filed by members of the public against South Bend Police Department. It includes the month and year of the complaint, the type, and the disposition or outcome. This dataset is cumulative, beginning 2016 and updated quarterly.

Things to note about this dataset:
  • Regardless of whether a complaint is filed, all uses of force go through the investigation process.
  • The Admin Investigations column indicates whether or not an additional misconduct, that was not related to what the original complaint was for, is discovered by SBPD staff while investigating the community complaint. (Ex, a driving infraction is noted by SBPD staff while reviewing a community complaint about professionalism).
  • Excessive Force and Use of Force are two different complaint types. Excessive Force questions if the amount of force was necessary while Use of Force questions whether the use of any force was necessary.
  • Open investigations are not part of this dataset, as they have not concluded yet.

For an expanded explanation on the process and definitions of dispositions, please refer to the Community Complaints Guide.

To see this data visualized, you can go to the SBPD Transparency Hub.

dataset.title: Part I Crimes Annual Totals
dataset.description:
This data set is up-to-date as of 2017, but is no longer actively maintained by the City of South Bend.

Updated crime data for South Bend can be found on the following website: https://crime-data-explorer.fr.cloud.gov/explorer/agency/IN0710200/crime

This data set contains historic annual totals for the FBI's Uniform Crime Reporting Program. Includes violent and property crime data for South Bend from 1992 through 2017. 

*Note that the agency reporting definition of rape changed in 2013, so figures before and after the change may not be comparable.

dataset.title: Parks Locations and Features
dataset.description:
This data set is up-to-date as of 2017, but is no longer actively maintained by the City of South Bend.

This is a data set of parks managed by the City of South Bend's Department of Venues Parks & Arts, including features available at each location.

Updated information about parks managed by VPA can be found on the following website: https://sbvpa.org/find-a-place/

dataset.title: Social Services St Joseph County
dataset.description:
This data set is up-to-date as of 2017, but is no longer actively maintained by the City of South Bend. 

For comprehensive and updated information please visit the following websites:
  • City of South Bend COVID-19 Resources & Support: https://southbendin.gov/covid-19-resources-support/
  • United Way of St. Joseph County Emergency Resources: https://uwsjc.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/emergency-resources-updates.pdf
  • Indiana 211: https://in211.communityos.org/

This data set is a partial listing of social services available in St. Joseph County, including organization type, location, contact information, and hours of operation, if known. This is not a comprehensive list.

dataset.description:
This is a direct link to the city's Police Transparency Hub. Navigate here to see a centralized location for various documents, dashboards, and datasets on Police Transparency.

To access various documents, dashboards and datasets on Police Transparency, follow the direct link below: 
https://southbendin.gov/transparency-and-performance/police-transparency-hub/

dataset.title: Code Enforcement Cases
dataset.description:
This data set includes information for all Code Enforcement cases opened or active with the City of South Bend's Department of Code Enforcement beginning June 29, 2019.

The following information is provided:
  • Property address associated with the case
  • Citation ID and description of the case type
  • Data that the case was opened; a closed date is provided if the case has since been resolved
  • Status information of the case (active vs closed)
This information is up to date as of June 29, 2020. Updated annually.

dataset.title: 2019 Amended Budget
dataset.description:
This is a data set of the City of South Bend's amended budget from 2019 broken down by revenue and expense accounts.

It includes the following data:
  • Fund: Fund means "cash" or a group of accounts set aside for the purpose of accounting for moneys or other resources of general functions or specific activities such as utilities, construction projects or other activities of a city or town in accordance with a system of accounts prescribed by the State Board of Accounts or as required by statute.
  • Department: The organizational unit typically classified by the functions or services performed by the unit.
  • Division: The organizational unit of a department. Some departments have only one division.
  • Subdivision: A further breakdown of the divisions within a department. Some departments have only one subdivision.
  • Main Account: The type of general ledger account for transaction and reporting purposes.
  • Account Type: A unique place in the general ledger that is used for recording a dollar balance along with a history of changes to that balance.
  • GL Account: General ledger account number.
This information is current as of December 31, 2019.

dataset.title: 2018 Amended Budget
dataset.description:
This is a data set of the City of South Bend's amended budget from 2018 broken down by revenue and expense accounts.

It includes the following data:
  • Fund: Fund means "cash" or a group of accounts set aside for the purpose of accounting for moneys or other resources of general functions or specific activities such as utilities, construction projects or other activities of a city or town in accordance with a system of accounts prescribed by the State Board of Accounts or as required by statute.
  • Department: The organizational unit typically classified by the functions or services performed by the unit.
  • Division: The organizational unit of a department. Some departments have only one division.
  • Subdivision: A further breakdown of the divisions within a department. Some departments have only one subdivision.
  • Main Account: The type of general ledger account for transaction and reporting purposes.
  • Account Type: A unique place in the general ledger that is used for recording a dollar balance along with a history of changes to that balance.
  • GL Account: General ledger account number.
This information is current as of December 31, 2018.

dataset.title: Historic - Criminally Assaulted Shootings
dataset.description:
This dataset includes fatal and non fatal, criminally assaulted shooting victims in South Bend beginning in 2015. This is a historic dataset up through 2021.


To see our newly updated map go to Fatal/Non fatal Shooting Victims Map.
View the new downloadable dataset at 

Note: that location is provided at the 100 block level rather than the exact location of the incident. If the location of the incident is unknown, the incident will not appear on the map, but is included in the table. The time listed in the date/time field is a default time provided by the application and does not reflect the actual time of the incident.

To access various documents, dashboards and datasets on Police Transparency, click here.

dataset.title: Criminally Assaulted Shooting Victims - GMI Table
dataset.description:
This is a downloadable table of criminally assaulted shooting victims beginning in 2019. These incidents are designated as GMI (Group Member Involved), non, or unknown.

To see this data as an interactive map, view the GMI Shooting Victim Map

GMI = Group Member Involved
Non = standalone shootings unrelated to group activity
Unknown = not known whether or not the shooting was related to group activity

To learn more about GMI and Group Violence Intervention, visit the Police Transparency Hub!

dataset.title: 2020 City of South Bend Survey Data
dataset.description:
This table is the raw data of the Community Survey conducted in 2020. This survey is sent out on a biannual basis. The purpose of the community survey is to gather input from residents on City services and their priorities to inform decision-making and strategic investment. The survey data is compiled and analyzed by ETC Institute, one of the nation's leading firms in the field of local governmental research. All individual responses to the survey remain confidential. 

Visit https://southbendin.gov/communitysurvey/ to see the full webpage and dashboard for this data.

dataset.title: Criminally Assaulted Shooting Victims - Fatals Table
dataset.description:
This is a downloadable table of criminally assaulted shooting victims beginning in 2021. These incidents are designated as fatal or non fatal and do not include accidentals or suicides. This is updated monthly.

To see this data as an interactive map, view the Fatal Shooting Victim Map
To see historic data from 2017 through 2021, view the Historic Criminally Assaulted Shooting Table

To learn more about the South Bend Police Department and Group Violence Intervention, visit the Police Transparency Hub!

dataset.title: Administrative Investigations - Table
dataset.description:
This dataset provides information about complaints filed by staff of the South Bend Police Department against other staff. It includes the month and year of the complaint, the type, and the disposition or outcome. This dataset is cumulative, beginning 2018 and updated quarterly.

Things to note about this dataset:

  • Regardless of whether a complaint is filed, all uses of force go through the investigation process.
  • The MNBC column indicates whether or not an additional misconduct, that was not related to what the original investigation was for, is discovered by SBPD staff. (Ex, a driving infraction is noted by SBPD staff while reviewing an Administrative Investigation about professionalism).
  • Excessive Force and Use of Force are two different complaint types. Excessive Force questions if the amount of force was necessary while Use of Force questions whether the use of any force was necessary.
  • Open investigations are not part of this dataset, as they have not concluded yet.

For an expanded explanation on the process and definitions of dispositions, please refer to the Community Complaints Guide.

To see this data visualized, you can go to the SBPD Transparency Hub.

dataset.title: CentralServices.Code.PowerBI All VA
dataset.description:
This is a map of all properties that are actively listed under Continuous Enforcement with the City of South Bend's Department of Code Enforcement. Properties are added to Continuous Enforcement when a pattern of violations (more than 4 in a year, or 3 violations that were cleaned up by the City in a year) indicates that the property is not being maintained by the owner. The owner is notified at the address of record that any environmental violations found at these properties are cleaned and billed by the City as they are found, without additional notification to the owner, as long as the Continuous Enforcement order remains in effect. This map includes the following data:
  • Property identification details (parcel IDs and address)
  • Location (coordinates may be missing for parcels that have been consolidated)
  • The date in which the property's Continuous Enforcement status expires. This information is current as of 2022-03-11. Updated weekly.

dataset.title: Street Lights
dataset.description:
This data set is up-to-date as of 2016, but is no longer actively maintained by the City of South Bend.

This published service shows the location and characteristics of street lights located in the City of South Bend.

A link to a color-descriptive version of this data can be found at http://southbend.maps.arcgis.com/home/webmap/viewer.html?webmap=a11c4eb0d2c64183b9843c9f12782c64.

dataset.title: South Bend Certified Realtors
dataset.description:
This data set is up-to-date as of 2017, but is no longer actively maintained by the City of South Bend, due to a discontinuation of this program.

This data set includes information for members involved with the South Bend Certified Realtors Program, a previous initiative of the City made up of a committee which included local Realtors, representatives from the colleges and universities, Indiana Landmarks, Center for History, the media and the City.

The purpose of this initiative was to promote the neighborhoods of South Bend to residents, newcomers, the business community, universities, Realtors and builders through the following activities:
  1. Better inform these and other groups about the South Bend's assets.
  2. Provide these groups with information about housing options in South Bend's lovely neighborhoods.
  3. Offer a list of South Bend Certified Realtors to assist new and existing employees with their housing needs.
  4. Present a series of classes to various groups and the general public to educate and inform them about the City's neighborhoods.
  5. Sponsor events and works in collaboration with other organizations to promote housing within certain target areas of the City.

dataset.title: 311 Phone Call Log
dataset.description:
This data set is up-to-date as of 2017, but is no longer actively maintained by the City of South Bend.

This temporarily static table displays all call data from 311 from 9/29/16 through 4/14/2017.

dataset.title: 311 Open and Held Calls - Archive
dataset.description:
This data set is up-to-date as of 2017, but is no longer actively maintained by the City of South Bend.

This table lists a snapshot of open or held calls from 311 as recently as 2/27/2017. As this data is from a contact management system that is no longer in use, this data set will remain static.

dataset.title: 311 Contact Management Cases
dataset.description:
This data set is up-to-date as of 2016, but is no longer actively maintained by the City of South Bend.

Historical data on 311 Contact Management Cases including call type, call status, and work group fields.

dataset.title: 311 Call Center Activity by Day
dataset.description:
This data set is up-to-date as of 2017, but is no longer actively maintained by the City of South Bend.

Call statistics from 311 including call volume, abandon rate, average wait time, and average talk time, broken out by day.

dataset.title: City of South Bend Fuel Usage
dataset.description:
This data set includes monthly fuel usage information for all departments of the City of South Bend. Unleaded, diesel, and compressed natural gas use are included in usage and cost calculations. Information is provided by month per department starting in 2018.

This information is current as of April 2020. Updated monthly.

dataset.title: Fraternal Order of Police Working Agreement
dataset.description:
This document is a Working Agreement between the City of South Bend and the Fraternal Order of Police Lodge No. 36.

The purpose of this Working Agreement is to:
  • Achieve and maintain harmonious relations between the City and the Lodge which are in the best interests of the Community.
  • Improve public safety in the areas of public police protection.
  • Provide for equitable and peaceful adjustment of differences which may arise.
  • Further a mutual and voluntary effort to promote and maintain sound labor relations.
  • Establish other conditions of employment.
This Agreement is effective from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2020.

dataset.title: CentralServices.Code.PowerBI All VA
dataset.description:
This is a map of all properties that are scheduled for inspection or are registered under South Bend's Rental Safety Verification Program (RSVP) and their corresponding status beginning March 2019.

It includes the following data:
  • Property identification details (parcel IDs and addresses)
  • Property RSVP status (please see terminology definitions below)
  • Expiration date of RSVP certification or exemption
  • Name of property owner and owner's business name (if applicable)
  • Location (coordinates may be missing for parcels that have been consolidated)Terminology for property status:
    • Certified - property has met minimum standards
    • Condemned - property has extensive, major violations and the property is unsafe for occupancy
    • Conditional Certification - property requires non-critical repairs that can't be completed within 60 days (typically weather dependent, exterior repairs)
    • - property is owner-occupied and\/or non-residential
    • Exempt - property does not require an RSVP inspection (most often due to having received an inspection by another agency in the last 12 months)
    • Illegal for Non-owner Occupancy - inspections initiated or completed but property has not achieved certification

dataset.title: CentralServices.Code.PowerBI All VA
dataset.description:
This is a map of all properties that are or were vacant and abandoned and received a repair or demolition order on one or more structures on the property beginning April 2013.

It includes the following data:

  • Status of the most recent case for the property and structure (active or closed)
  • Property identification details (parcel IDs and addresses)
  • Current order or upcoming hearing type for the property
  • Previous or upcoming hearing date
  • Details on the last compliance (for those properties that are closed or have been closed, then reopened)
  • Location (coordinatesmay be missing for pacels that have been consolidated)

dataset.title: CentralServices.Code.PowerBI All VA
dataset.description:
This is a map of properties with active demolition orders as of 2022-03-11.

Lists are limited to properties with active cases relating to Indiana's Unsafe Building Law managed by the City of South Bend's Department of Code Enforcement.

It includes the following data:

  • Property identification details (parcel IDs and addresses)
  • Indication of whether the property is vacant or abandoned
  • Structures ordered to be demolished
  • Location (coordinates may be missing for parcels that have been consolidated)

dataset.title: Criminally Assaulted Shooting Victims - Group Member Involved
dataset.description:
This map includes GMI, not GMI, and unknown criminally assaulted shootings by victim in South Bend for the current year. Hovering over the map indicates whether the shooting incident was related to GMI or not.

GMI = Group Member Involved

To access various documents, dashboards and datasets on Police Transparency, click here.

dataset.title: 2019 Receipts & Disbursements
dataset.description:
This is a data set of the City of South Bend's receipts and disbursements from 2019 broken down by revenue and expense accounts on a monthly basis.

It includes the following data:
  • Fund: Fund means "cash" or a group of accounts set aside for the purpose of accounting for moneys or other resources of general functions or specific activities such as utilities, construction projects or other activities of a city or town in accordance with a system of accounts prescribed y the State Board of Accounts or as required by statute.
  • Department: The organizational unit typically classified by the functions or services performed by the unit.
  • Division: The organizational unit of a department. Some departments only have one division.
  • Subdivision: A further breakdown of the divisions within a department. Some departments have only one subdivision.
  • Main Account: The type of general ledger account for transaction and reporting purposes.
  • Account Type: A unique place in the general ledger that is used for recording a dollar balance along with a history of changes to that balance.
  • GL Account: General ledger account number.
This information is current as of December 31, 2019.

dataset.title: City Spending  Cash Disbursements
dataset.description:
This data is cumulative and includes all cash disbursements by the City of South Bend for supplies, services, and public works, beginning 2019. This data does not include City employee payroll, payments for legal services, or legal settlements.

Note: This data set is a combination of exports from two separate systems. Therefore, some columns are blank for portions of a year due to the migration of systems.

dataset.title: South Bend Elementary School District Boundaries
dataset.description:
This is a map of boundaries for elementary school districts in the South Bend Community Schools Corporation.
Updated June 2020.

dataset.title: Continuous Enforcement
dataset.description:
This is a map of all properties that are actively listed under Continuous Enforcement with the City of South Bend's Department of Code Enforcement. Properties are added to Continuous Enforcement when a pattern of violations (more than 4 in a year, or 3 violations that were cleaned up by the City in a year) indicates that the property is not being maintained by the owner. The owner is notified at the address of record that any environmental violations found at these properties are cleaned and billed by the City as they are found, without additional notification to the owner, as long as the Continuous Enforcement order remains in effect. This map includes the following data:
  • Property identification details (parcel IDs and address)
  • Location (coordinates may be missing for parcels that have been consolidated)
  • The date in which the property's Continuous Enforcement status expires. This information is current as of 2022-03-11. Updated weekly.

dataset.title: 2021 Employee Benefits Guide
dataset.description:
This Benefit Guide is made available to all employees eligible for benefits through the City of South Bend. It provides a general overview of benefits available to employees.

This Guide is effective from January 1, 2021 to December 31, 2021.

dataset.title: South Bend Businesses Open to All Customers
dataset.description:
This data set is up-to-date as of 2017, but is no longer actively maintained by the City of South Bend.

These businesses are committed to a welcoming environment for everyone regardless of race, religion, or sexual orientation.

dataset.title: Green Tour Database
dataset.description:
This data set is up-to-date as of July 2017, but is no longer maintained by the City of South Bend, due to the discontinuation of this program. 

This data set contains information regarding the Green Tour, a program previously hosted by the City of South Bend's Sustainability office. This data indicates locations that meet various sustainability criteria and the specific type of tour each location belonged to.

dataset.title: Firefighter's Local 362 Collective Bargaining Agreement
dataset.description:
This document is a Collective Bargaining Agreement between the Board of Public Safety, acting for and on behalf of the City of South Bend and the South Bend Firefighter's Association, Local No. 362 of the International Association of Firefighters, AFL-CIO.

The purpose of this Agreement is to:
  • Achieve and maintain harmonious relations between the City and the Union in the best interest of the community.
  • Provide for equitable and peaceful adjustment of differences which may arise.
  • Improve public safety in the areas of public firefighting services, emergency medical service, water and aerial rescue services, hazardous material emergency response services, swift water rescue, technical rescue, fire protection services in the area of Code Enforcement and public education, and fire and arson investigation services.
  • Establish hours and other conditions of employment.
This Agreement is effective from January 1, 2018 to December 31, 2021.

dataset.title: RSVP
dataset.description:
This is a map of all properties that are scheduled for inspection or are registered under South Bend's Rental Safety Verification Program (RSVP) and their corresponding status beginning March 2019.

It includes the following data:
  • Property identification details (parcel IDs and addresses)
  • Property RSVP status (please see terminology definitions below)
  • Expiration date of RSVP certification or exemption
  • Name of property owner and owner's business name (if applicable)
  • Location (coordinates may be missing for parcels that have been consolidated)Terminology for property status:
    • Certified - property has met minimum standards
    • Condemned - property has extensive, major violations and the property is unsafe for occupancy
    • Conditional Certification - property requires non-critical repairs that can't be completed within 60 days (typically weather dependent, exterior repairs)
    • - property is owner-occupied and\/or non-residential
    • Exempt - property does not require an RSVP inspection (most often due to having received an inspection by another agency in the last 12 months)
    • Illegal for Non-owner Occupancy - inspections initiated or completed but property has not achieved certification
    • Inspection Process - property has an RSVP inspection scheduled
    • Under Review - we have initiated contact with the owner to schedule an inspection ~ or ~ someone has contacted Code Enforcement to schedule an inspection - but no inspection has been scheduled yet

dataset.title: All Vacant and Abandoned Properties
dataset.description:
This is a map of all properties that are or were vacant and abandoned and received a repair or demolition order on one or more structures on the property beginning April 2013.

It includes the following data:

  • Status of the most recent case for the property and structure (active or closed)
  • Property identification details (parcel IDs and addresses)
  • Current order or upcoming hearing type for the property
  • Previous or upcoming hearing date
  • Details on the last compliance (for those properties that are closed or have been closed, then reopened)
  • Location (coordinatesmay be missing for pacels that have been consolidated)

dataset.title: All VA
dataset.description:
This is a map of all properties that are or were vacant and abandoned and received a repair or demolition order on one or more structures on the property beginning April 2013.

It includes the following data:

  • Status of the most recent case for the property and structure (active or closed)
  • Property identification details (parcel IDs and addresses)
  • Current order or upcoming hearing type for the property
  • Previous or upcoming hearing date
  • Details on the last compliance (for those properties that are closed or have been closed, then reopened)
  • Location (coordinatesmay be missing for pacels that have been consolidated)

dataset.title: Active Demolition Orders
dataset.description:
This is a map of properties with active demolition orders as of 2022-03-11.

Lists are limited to properties with active cases relating to Indiana's Unsafe Building Law managed by the City of South Bend's Department of Code Enforcement.

It includes the following data:

  • Property identification details (parcel IDs and addresses)
  • Indication of whether the property is vacant or abandoned
  • Structures ordered to be demolished
  • Location (coordinates may be missing for parcels that have been consolidated)

dataset.title: Continuous Enforcement
dataset.description:
This is a map of all properties that are actively listed under Continuous Enforcement with the City of South Bend's Department of Code Enforcement. Properties are added to Continuous Enforcement when a pattern of violations (more than 4 in a year, or 3 violations that were cleaned up by the City in a year) indicates that the property is not being maintained by the owner. The owner is notified at the address of record that any environmental violations found at these properties are cleaned and billed by the City as they are found, without additional notification to the owner, as long as the Continuous Enforcement order remains in effect. This map includes the following data:
  • Property identification details (parcel IDs and address)
  • Location (coordinates may be missing for parcels that have been consolidated)
  • The date in which the property's Continuous Enforcement status expires. This information is current as of 2022-03-11. Updated weekly.

dataset.title: Criminally Assaulted Shooting Victims
dataset.description: Note that this does not include non-shooting homicides. Addresses are geocoded to the nearest available location and based on the information we have available. The location is not known for all incidents.
